quest.name: Doing It the Bard Way
journal: Jehantel assents to sing for you the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool.
After singing the ballad for you, Jehantel asks that you travel to the Gelmorra Ruins in the North Shroud. Once there, you are to lay a bouquet of Nymeia lilies at the resting place of the fallen.
You have laid the flowers at the resting place as instructed by Jehantel. Return to the South Shroud and speak with the bard at his camp west of Quarrymill.

You have returned to Jehantel at his camp. You learn from the tormented bard that the vainglorious fool of the ballad is none other than himself. With the deaths of his companions weighing heavily on his soul, Jehantel could never again summon the will to bend back his bow. He also regrets exposing you to danger, but nevertheless has a further request to make of you. Speak with the bard once more when you have steeled your resolve.
objectives: Lay the bouquet of Nymeia lilies at the resting place of the fallen at the Gelmorra Ruins.
Speak with Jehantel at his camp west of Quarrymill.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. By your tranquil countenance, it is plain that both your body and soul are in readiness for the next stage of your journey.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Very well. The time is ripe that I teach you the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The song tells the tale of an archer of the Gods' Quiver whose peerless skill was surpassed only by his hubris.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Alas, that hubris led to the annihilation of his entire regiment at the battle which has come to be called the Massacre of Griffin Crossing. Ahem!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
Standing guard in dead of night,♪
An archer, wearying of the sight,♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
Drunk on pride and starved of glory,♪
Forsook his post to claim victory.♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
Ten score yalms had the archer crept,♪
When shrieks rang out whence his comrades slept,♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
For he was not there to see the knives,♪
Nor to ring the bell and save friends' lives.♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Tell me, Forename, what lessons can be learned from this tale?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah, but hold that thought─what your tongue claims to understand interests me not.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: As before, I'd sooner have you demonstrate the fruits of your learning with bow in hand. This time, however, you shall have the pleasure of my company.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I would have you escort me to the Gelmorra Ruins in the North Shroud. It is there that some few fallen from the Massacre of Griffin Crossing have been laid to rest. Pray honor this place of remembrance with a bouquet of lilies.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Heed me, O Puissant Althyk! Cast Thee back the rains to the firmament, that we might gaze upon the battles of yore!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The enemy van!?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: No... I...I cannot...

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Why? Why do I still draw breath?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
That a sin of the past would beget another...
Forgive me, Forename.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: As you have doubtless noticed, I am no longer capable of wielding a bow─I, whom they call the Godsbow.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I had hoped that the years would take the edge off the memories...but I hoped in vain. Absolution does not come so easily. Heed me well, Forename, for I shall reveal all to you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The man sung of in the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool, whose hubris doomed an entire regiment─he and I are one and the same.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Being no stranger to the bow, you will know that the archer's role in battle is that of support. His charge is to thin out the enemy line, that his comrades might gain ground in the field of battle.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: By that most basic of criteria, I was unfit to hold a bow from the first.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In my pride and lust for glory, I sent countless souls to a bloody grave─good men and women all, with loved ones and bright futures awaiting them. I lost the will to live that day, becoming an empty husk of a man, tormented in sleep and wakefulness both by the memories of my crime.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: But the gods were not without mercy. They gifted me with song, that I might find a measure of solace in my wretched existence.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: A new melody resounds within you, I see. Though this outing was rather far departed from what I had in mind, that it still bore fruit gives me comfort.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: On that note, let us conclude the lesson. I daresay I have no cause to worry that you will repeat the selfsame mistake as the vainglorious fool.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Forename, I would be alone for a while. Take yourself back to camp─I shall make my own way there presently.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I am glad to see you safely returned. Though I rasp my voice hoarse through the saying of it, I cannot tell you enough times how much I regret dragging you into such danger.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: ...And yet, there is more I would ask of you. If you would do me the kindness of lending your ear, then pray speak now.
